botanical_details.genus: Solanum can be annuals, perennials, evergreen or deciduous shrubs or twining climbers, with simple or pinnnately lobed leaves and star- or bowl-shaped, 5-lobed flowers with prominent stamens, followed by fleshy fruits

how_to_grow.cultivation: Start from seed or buy as small plants and grow on in a heated greenhouse or on a warm windowsill. Move to an unheated greenhouse or outside once all risk of frost has passed, and provide support for the plant to grow up. Water regularly to keep the growing media evenly moist; inconsistent watering can lead to splitting and rot. Feed every 10-14 days. See advice on cultivating tomatoes for more detail
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed sown at 18-20ºC (64-68ºF) in late winter or early spring
how_to_grow.pruning: Pinch out the growing tip when the plant has reached the desired height, either reaching the top of the greenhouse or support, or when the plant has set seven trusses indoors or four trusses outdoors. Regularly remove all side shoots.
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to aphids and whitefly
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to tomato leaf mould, tomato and potato blight, verticillium wilt, fusarium wilt and tomato viruses
